name: pull_request_reactions
description: Tracks the number of reactions on pull requests, allowing users to query reactions for specific pull requests.

dimensions.name: pr_number
dimensions.description: The unique number identifying a pull request.

dimensions.name: reaction_content
dimensions.description: The type of reaction given to a pull request, such as thumbs up or heart.

dimensions.name: user_login
dimensions.description: The login of the user who reacted to the pull request.

measures.name: reaction_count
measures.description: The total number of reactions on a pull request.

sample_questions: How many reactions did PR 67 get?
What are the reactions on pull request number 42?
sql_to_underlying_datasource: SELECT pr.number as pr_number, r.content as reaction_content, r.user__login as user_login, COUNT(*) as reaction_count FROM pull_requests.pull_requests pr JOIN issues.issues__reactions r ON pr.number = r._dlt_parent_id GROUP BY pr.number, r.content, r.user__login
